issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
Assessment

Currently, if there is any issues with the iSCSI connection (especially buffer I/O issues) between the NetApp SAN device and the Node controller, Eucalyptus doesn't provide any useful logging information. Due to the lack of information in the logs, this caused some confusion around where the problem was actually with the system. Ultimately, the /var/log/messages log file shed light as to what was causing the issue.

This is a feature request to add the ability provide better logging (whether in the nc.log or a fault log) when there are any iSCSI communication issues on the NC.

Signs

    Error message in /var/log/messages:
{code}
    Jun 25 19:05:01 pi-nc-05 kernel: Loading iSCSI transport class v2.0-870.

    Jun 25 19:05:05 pi-nc-05 iscsid: Connection1:0 to [target: iqn.1992-08.com.netapp:sn.7167e530f7f111e3a72a123478563412:vs.5, portal: 10.252.26.50,3260] through [iface: default] is operational now 
    Jun 25 19:06:06 pi-nc-05 kernel: connection1:0: detected conn error (1021)

{code}
    When cloud user attempts to attach a volume to an instance, the volume state goes from 'attaching' to 'available'.
    Error in nc.log:
{code}
    2014-06-25 19:06:10 ERROR | libvirt: cannot read header '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-3600a0980426262385824456c356a7349': Input/output error (code=38)

    2014-06-25 19:06:20 ERROR | operation on 72.5.25.132 could not be invoked (check SC host, port, and credentials)

    2014-06-25 19:06:20 ERROR | [i-a69778a6][vol-36ae1a24] failed error=1
{code}
fields.summary: Improve Error Messaging on Node Controller - NetApp SAN Integration

comments.body:
The 2 dimensions to check are: command-path and data-path from NC to the SAN/SC.
Command-path:
* iscsiadm commands to get targets, and connect to a LUN.
The NC does command path checks via the iscsi_*.pl scripts in /usr/share/eucalyptus/. If those fail, it indicates connectivity issues on the network to the SAN/SC.

Data-path:
* read/write data to the attached LUN/blockdev.
Data-path checks are done currently only by libvirt/KVM when the device is exposed to the VM. Failures in read/write may indicate network, SAN configuration, or SAN-internal issues.

The specific failure signature in this ticket was unique because the failure was internal to the Netapp, so the network and command-paths were just fine.

There are also logging improvements we can make in the CLC to indicate it has timed-out the attach-request and is initiating rollback/cleanup. In the SC logs it can be seen that this is occurring when a 'DetachVolume' request hits the SC as that request type is only used for forcible rollback during failed attachment.

We are planning to address this issue during Ceph integration development as well. As a fall-back plan we can fix the current perl-script implementation. Once we have the specific ticket numbers for the subtasks I will link one to this so it can be tracked.
We are building tools for this in a future release
